title: Donald Trump Turned Georgia Blue
summary: His relentless attacks on the state's election apparatus likely depressed Republican turnout.. The Democrats' twin victories in Tuesday's Georgia Senate runoffs create a political dynamic in Washington that isn't out of line with recent precedent. Joe Biden will enter the presidency, after wresting it from the other party, with majorities for his party in both houses of Congress. Bill Clinton managed the same feat in 1993. So did George W. Bush in 2001, Barack Obama in 2009 and Donald Trump in 2017. Indeed, the Bush Republican majorities in 2001 (51-50 in the Senate and 221-213 in the House) were almost identical to the Biden Democratic majorities now (51-50 in the Senate and 222-211 in the House).

title: Jimmy Lai's Message of Hope
summary: The jailed Hong Kong democracy activist isn't giving up.. Jimmy Lai began 2021 in jail. The detention last month of the prominent Hong Kong businessman and democracy activist suggested that the Chinese Communist Party was looking to crack down on dissent. The hammer dropped this week, with the mass arrest of 53 other democracy proponents in Hong Kong.

title: The Republican Party Is in Disarray
summary: The Senate is lost, the GOP is bitterly split and Trump's actions have consequences.. President Trump may have been correct at his Monday rally when he said of Georgia Republican Sens. David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler: "If they win I'll get no credit, and if they lose they're going to blame Trump." But Tuesday's election and Wednesday's mob assault on Congress were stark examples of the destructive reactions the president can generate.

title: Corporate Debt 'Relief' Is an Economic Dud
summary: Most companies benefiting from the Fed's bond buys didn't need the cash, and didn't spend it well either.. Conservatives accuse progressives of wanting to destroy capitalism. Yet a greater threat than Bernie Sanders is the prospect of serial market bailouts by monetary authorities-first the banking system in 2008, and now the entire business world amid the pandemic. The Treasury Department and Congress have moved to curtail the Federal Reserve's ability to prop up already bloated corporate debt markets. That's a step in the right direction-the Fed's corporate credit facilities should be left to die.

title: The SPAC Bubble May Burst-and Not a Day Too Soon
summary: The hot new way to take companies public hurts most investors, and its track record is now clear.. There's a growing fad on Wall Street: special-purpose acquisition companies, or SPACs. Touted as a better way to take companies public, SPACs have raised more equity in 2020 than over the entire preceding decade. But please, take a minute before jumping in-our research suggests that this trend will end poorly for a large majority of investors.

title: Trump's Trumpian Final Days
summary: Amid the Electoral College challenge, the president is putting the substance of his achievements at risk.. The greatest threat to Donald Trump's legacy is if his American presidency is seen by future historians as ending in farce and tragedy. We may be there.

title: Notable & Quotable: Mitch McConnell on the Presidential Electors and No Double Standard
summary: 'The voters, the courts, and the states have all spoken. If we overrule them all, it would damage our republic forever.'. From Majority Leader Mitch McConnell's remarks on the Senate floor, Jan. 6, 2021:

title: 'Foretelling the End of Capitalism' Review: Still Free and Alive
summary: Belief in capitalism's impending demise is as old as capitalism itself, and is rooted in an even older philosophy of utopian thinking.. Never judge a book by its cover. And never, probably, begin a review by quoting that line. But I think it's appropriate here. For as I gazed at the cover of Francesco Boldizzoni's "Foretelling the End of Capitalism: Intellectual Misadventures Since Karl Marx" and noticed the presence of the Grim Reaper, I prepared myself for a detailed discussion of the millenarianism that has characterized leftist thinking, not only since Marx but indeed long before him.

title: Covid-19 Vaccines Have Triggered Severe Allergic Reactions in 29 People in U.S. to Date
summary: Rate of reactions to Covid-19 vaccines is higher than it is for flu shot, but the CDC says it is rare and encourages inoculation. At least 29 people in the U.S. have developed severe allergic reactions to Covid-19 vaccines, federal health authorities said Wednesday.

title: China's Bid for Financial Supremacy and Us
summary: Beijing's efforts to lure investors aren't a threat to the U.S. as much as they're a positive incentive for the U.S. to similarly pursue better policies. What will make China rich will also lift the U.S. Growth is a choice.. Kevin Warsh writes that Beijing has pursued renminbi strength in recent years just as "fiscal and monetary support for its economy has become less expansionary"("Beijing's Bid for Financial Supremacy," op-ed, Jan. 5). Credible money paired with reduced government spending have long been pillars of conservative rhetoric stateside, and with good reason. Per Mr. Warsh once again, these policies are consistent with "better, safer returns" for investors whose capital commitments drive all economic growth. Wealth isn't taken from a fixed pie as some who fear China's rise apparently assume; rather it's created. It's a reminder that Beijing's efforts to lure investors aren't a threat to the U.S. as much as they're a positive incentive for the U.S. to similarly pursue better policies. What will make China rich will also lift the U.S. Growth is a choice.

title: Overregulation and the Precision Cherry Pie
summary: Your account in "Liberation Day for French Dressing" of federal regulation of the composition of French salad dressing and ketchup down to its pH content is why I marvel whenever I hear that we need more regulation.. Your account in "Liberation Day for French Dressing" (Review & Outlook, Dec. 28) of federal regulation of the composition of French salad dressing down to its pH content is why I marvel whenever I hear that we need more regulation. I am reminded of the bromidic liberal refrain of "getting the government out of the bedroom." Not only is the government in the bedroom, it is in the living room, the dining room, the bathroom and every other room. Government is so deep into our kitchens that it is in our salad dressing.

title: Solution to Hartford's Woes Will Be Complex
summary: Hartford has its share of self-inflicted wounds. But many of them are the product of decisions made long ago by folks who later decamped to surrounding towns to take advantage of government-backed loans that favored suburbia.. Hartford has its share of self-inflicted wounds. But many of them-like pension obligations-are the product of decisions made long ago by folks who later decamped to surrounding towns to take advantage of government-backed loans that favored suburbia. Although Bob Stefanowski lambastes regionalism, it's actually common in the southern and western regions that Connecticut Republicans seem to view as the promised land ("What Isn't the Matter With Hartford?," Cross Country, Jan. 2). Hartford is 18 square miles; Charlotte, N.C., is 309 and growing.

title: We Need Oversight of Presidential Pardons
summary: The presidential pardons and commutations are an outrage. The presidential pardons and commutations are an outrage to anyone who believes that massive cheating, stealing, witness tampering, tax fraud, murder and ripping off the public is OK for well-connected Trump supporters and partisans. "Trump Pardons 15, Including Campaign, Blackwater Figures" (Page One, Dec. 23) and "Trump Pardons Manafort, Stone, 24 Others" (Page One, Dec. 24). Pardoning corrupt congressmen, a Florida crook who swindled billions in the largest Medicare fraud on record, Blackwater contractors who killed more than a dozen Iraqi civilians and those who wilfully lied to the FBI to cover up for individual No. 1 in the Mueller probe (whose full content is still redacted) is a disgrace. Law and order and ethical and moral governance mean nothing to the president and there are no consequences for corruption at the highest level.

title: New York Eyes Legalizing Sports Betting, Marijuana
summary: Lawmakers are set to confront a projected budget deficit of more than $8.7 billion. New York lawmakers kicked off their 2021 legislative session with calls to alleviate the fiscal pain caused by the coronavirus pandemic and plans to consider the legalization of marijuana and online sports betting.

title: Check for Poisonous Plants Before Hiring Your Goats
summary: They are lovely and entertaining animals for sure, and eager landscapers, but are not smart enough to avoid plants that will kill them.. As a happy Wall Street Journal subscriber and goat owner, I was thrilled to see your article "Well-Employed During the Crisis: Landscaping Goats" (Page One, Dec. 16). I do need to caution anyone considering hiring goats to please be advised of plants on your property that could be poisonous to them. They are lovely and entertaining animals for sure, and eager landscapers, but are not smart enough to avoid plants that will kill them. Before hiring these beautiful creatures for property clearing, I ask only that you do your research and check your yard for poisonous plants.

title: Londoners Searching for More Space During Covid Are Buying Up English Country Manors
summary: Resume Subscription. The pandemic is having an unexpected side effect. Suddenly, Britons are eager for the space and grandeur of a country manor house. They are breathing life into Britain's prime country house real-estate market after a malaise in that sector that has lasted for more than a decade.

title: Pro-Trump Mob Forces Way Into Capitol; D.C. Orders Curfew
summary: President Trump urged supporters to pressure Congress to overturn President-elect Joe Biden's win. WASHINGTON-Rioters breached the Capitol on Wednesday afternoon as both the House and Senate were meeting inside after President Trump urged supporters to march there and pressure Congress to overturn President-elect Joe Biden's win.

title: What the Georgia Election Means for Markets
summary: The politics of reflation matters most for investors, but the long-term impact of elections is often quite different than it appears the day after the vote. Politics often matters to investors, but the way it matters isn't always obvious.

title: Costco Says Sales Rose 12% in December
summary: Increase driven by frozen foods, sundries and liquor sales despite lower frequency of sales tied to coronavirus restrictions. Costco Wholesale Corp. reported better than expected sales results for December as online shopping soared.

title: Trader Joe's Plans to Open Harlem Location
summary: The chain's grocery store will be an anchor tenant for 17-story development project on 125th Street. Trader Joe's has signed a lease to open a store in Harlem, marking the grocery-store chain's 13th location in New York City.

title: Stylistic Straitjacket
summary: The University of Virginia offers a case study on what to expect from President Trump's executive order decreeing that classicism will be the default style for future Federal Buildings.. The long-rumored plan to make classicism the sanctioned style for federal architecture recently became a reality when President Trump issued the "Executive Order on Promoting Beautiful Federal Civic Architecture" last month. This may seem like an inconsequential action in the waning days of the administration, but unless it's revoked by Joe Biden once he assumes the presidency it will endure, threatening to do lasting damage.

title: Trump's Ban on Chinese Apps Falls to Biden to Execute
summary: Restriction on use of Alipay, WeChat Pay and others wouldn't kick in until February. WASHINGTON-President Trump's latest executive order targeting Chinese tech platforms will fall to President-elect Joe Biden to enforce, or not, giving Mr. Biden a difficult political calculation to make in his first weeks in office.

title: U.S. 10-Year Treasury Yield Hits 1% for First Time Since March
summary: Yields started climbing as early returns from the Georgia runoff elections tilted toward Democrats. The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note rose above 1% for the first time since March on Wednesday, reflecting increased bets on additional fiscal stimulus after Georgia's runoff Senate elections.

title: Trump Loses the Senate
summary: His post-election tantrums hand the government to the left.. Republicans lost both Senate races in Georgia on Tuesday, losing control of the Upper Chamber, and you don't have to be Karl Rove to understand what happened.

title: NYSE Says Again It Will Delist Three Chinese Telecom Stocks
summary: New guidance from Treasury Department spurs exchange to delist shares to comply with Trump executive order. The New York Stock Exchange will move forward with delisting three Chinese telecommunications companies targeted by an executive order from President Trump, reversing course yet again after the NYSE said earlier this week that it wouldn't delist them.

title: SolarWinds Hack Breached Justice Department System
summary: Cyberattack potentially accessed 3% of the agency's Microsoft Office email accounts. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Justice Department has become the latest federal agency to say it was breached by hackers in the Russia-linked cyberattack that has ripped through government agencies and an unknown number of corporate networks.

title: Investors Learn to Love Unified Government
summary: Market reaction to Georgia runoff shows that partisan division in Washington is no longer good for stocks. The old cliché that investors prefer divided government is in need of an update.

title: New York City's Economic Recovery Is Years Away, Fiscal Watchdog Says
summary: Independent Budget Office predicts Covid-19 pandemic with cost the city $11.3 billion in lost tax revenue through fiscal year 2023. The Covid-19 pandemic will cast a long shadow over New York City's economic recovery, impacting employment levels, real-estate sales and tax revenue for years to come, according to the city's fiscal watchdog.

title: Biden's Agenda Gets Boost From Georgia Runoff Wins
summary: President-elect has said Democratic wins in Georgia would mean Americans are likely to get additional coronavirus relief checks. President-elect Joe Biden has a stronger shot at advancing his legislative agenda through a divided Senate after two runoff victories in Georgia gave Democrats control of the chamber.

title: Alaska Agency Is Biggest Bidder for Arctic Oil Leases
summary: President-elect Biden has pledged to block drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. WASHINGTON-An Alaskan state-owned agency was the biggest bidder for oil leases in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, federal officials said Wednesday, as they disclosed auction results that bring oil drillers a step closer to securing access to the pristine 19-million-acre wilderness.

title: What Happens When the Senate Is Split 50-50?
summary: After Democrats won both Georgia runoff races, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris will be able to break ties as needed. With President-elect Joe Biden set to be inaugurated on Jan. 20, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris will then become the tiebreaking vote in the Senate.

title: Fed Saw Bond-Buying Program Providing 'Very Significant' Support
summary: Minutes from December meeting show officials worrying about economic risks from surging virus cases, but hopeful about vaccines. title: Upper Bounds (Thursday Crossword, January 7)
The Capitol Disgrace
summary: Protesters interrupt the certification of the presidential election.. Protesters occupying the Capitol Building in Washington have delayed the certification of Joe Biden as President-elect. Serene financial markets suggest investors see no significant threat to the republic, but many Americans are sure to be appalled by the disturbing images from Washington of thousands of people unwilling to accept the election results and attempting to interrupt the transfer of power.

title: Biden to Name Merrick Garland as Attorney General
summary: The widely respected jurist, whose Supreme Court nomination was blocked by Republicans in 2016, will be tasked with steadying the Justice Department. WASHINGTON-President-elect Joe Biden intends to nominate Merrick Garland as attorney general, selecting a widely respected jurist and experienced prosecutor to steady a Justice Department rocked by years of political storms, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Hong Kong Activists Say Space for Democracy Is Shrinking

title: Covid-19 Vaccines Expected to Work on South Africa Coronavirus Strain
summary: Vaccines may be less effective against the variant that has come to dominate in South Africa, but are expected to have some benefit. JOHANNESBURG-A new variant of the coronavirus that is surging across South Africa may make the existing Covid-19 vaccines less effective, but is unlikely to be totally resistant to the shots, according to leading researchers who have studied the mutations and the vaccines.

title: Market Euphoria Helps Fuel Green Energy
summary: Money pouring into Tesla and its ilk speeds up transition to carbon-free energy. Whether investors one day regret paying so much for Tesla Inc. stock, they have done the planet a favor. summary: Moves allow for inoculating more people faster with limited supplies but risk offering less protection. summary: The department-store chain reveals more locations closing as part of its previous promise to shut 125 locations by 2023.

title: Gummies: The Only Way Gen Z Will Take a Vitamin?
summary: Tasty and trendy, "healthy" gummies are gaining in popularity over traditional vitamins. The joke was that, in 2012 when the episode aired, pickling was everywhere; every hipster restaurant menu seemed to offer something pickled. title: Hong Kong Police Arrest 53 Opposition Figures
summary: An American lawyer was also taken away. Operation is the biggest since the sweeping national security law was imposed six months ago.. HONG KONG-Police arrested more than 50 pro-democracy figures they accused of plotting to paralyze the Hong Kong government through the city's legislature, targeting much of the opposition camp's leadership in the biggest sweep using a national security law since it was imposed by China six months ago.

title: Nvidia Risks Blowback From New Crypto Bubble
summary: Surging ethereum prices may drive demand for mining gear with the latest gaming chips. The good news is that Nvidia won't have any problem selling its new gaming chips. The bad news might be who exactly gets their hands on them.

title: India's Vaccine Colossus Is a Model for the World to Follow
summary: Serum Institute to manufacture vaccines not just for the world's second-most populous country, but likely many others too. India has authorized two Covid-19 vaccines for use, putting its enormous vaccine-manufacturing capacity in the spotlight. Large parts of the rich world may have something valuable to learn.

title: Amazon Makes $2 Billion Affordable Housing Pledge
summary: Tech giant to make investments over next five years in and around Seattle, Arlington, Va., and Nashville, Tenn.. Amazon.com Inc. said it would commit more than $2 billion to create and preserve affordable housing in three of its employment hubs, the latest tech giant to make a large investment in easing the U.S. housing shortage.

title: How Congress Will Count-and Challenge-Biden's Electoral Votes
summary: Senate and House will convene a joint session and then debate and vote on objections to states' results. Congress is set to hold a joint session Wednesday to ratify Democrat President-elect Joe Biden's Electoral College win in the November election, in a final step ahead of his Jan. 20 inauguration. Some Republicans plan to raise challenges to some states' results, alleging election irregularities. Their objections are expected to force debate and votes in both chambers.

title: Trump Issues New Ban on Alipay and Other Chinese Apps
summary: President said the apps can access private information from their users, which could be used by the Chinese government. WASHINGTON-President Trump signed an executive order Tuesday banning transactions with eight Chinese-connected apps, including the Alipay payment platform owned by Chinese billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group Co. and apps owned by Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings Ltd.

title: WHO Criticizes China for Stymying Investigation Into Covid-19 Origins
summary: U.N. agency called out Beijing after its scientists weren't given permission to enter China to probe the pandemic. The World Health Organization took the rare step of criticizing China on Tuesday, using its first press conference of the new year to express disappointment that Beijing has still not given permission to United Nations investigators to probe the origins of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Risk Advisory Group COSO Plans More Detailed Recommendations in 2021
summary: The group is zeroing in on emerging risks, offering advice that is more prescriptive than the guidelines in its broad frameworks. The Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission-known for its influential, albeit somewhat abstract, risk management guidelines-is looking to provide more practicable advice on managing emerging risks.

title: How Did President Duterte's Guards Get Smuggled Covid Vaccines? Philippine Lawmakers Ask
summary: President has defended members of security detail who took the unauthorized shots in September and October. In September and October, members of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's security detail got Covid-19 vaccines. But no shots had been approved for use in the country-then or now.

title: Forget Uber, Zoom Might Be the Real Threat to Car Sales
summary: Covid-19 was easier on the car industry than initially expected, but might pose long-term challenges. So far, the car industry has emerged from the pandemic with just a few dents. The longer-term impact could be uglier.

title: Warnock Defeats Loeffler in Georgia Runoff, Bringing Democrats Closer to Senate Control
summary: A second Senate runoff remained too close to call, with the result set to determine the scope of President-elect Joe Biden's agenda. ATLANTA-Democrat Raphael Warnock, the pastor of Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. 's former church in Atlanta, defeated Republican Sen. Kelly Loeffler in a hotly contested runoff election, making him the first Black American to represent Georgia in the Senate and the first Democrat to do so since 2005.

title: Kim Jong Un Admits Past Failures, Promises Future Success
summary: North Korean leader, kicking off rare party-congress, vowed a new era of self-reliance. SEOUL-North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, kicking off a rare party-congress meeting, acknowledged economic failures and promised a new era of self-reliance.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Pence Faces Dilemma Over Biden Confirmation, as Trump Digs In
summary: Vice president seeks to balance constitutional role in ratifying Nov. 3 results with president's concerns. DALTON, Ga.-Rallying voters in Georgia on the eve of Tuesday's Senate runoff elections, President Trump delivered a political message to an entirely different audience: his vice president.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook's Pay Jumped in 2020 as Remote Work Lifted Profit
summary: Executive's cash bonus increased after Apple beat internal financial goals. Apple Inc. said it exceeded its internal financial targets in the past fiscal year, resulting in the company paying out 179% of the targeted bonuses for named officers.

title: Wyndham Destinations Buys Travel + Leisure From Meredith
summary: Meredith to continue publishing Travel + Leisure under licensing agreement; Wyndham to rebrand itself. Wyndham Destinations Inc. is buying the Travel + Leisure publication from Meredith Corp. for $100 million, in a deal that would expand Wyndham's business beyond its core vacation-ownership operations.

title: Amazon Banned From Using AWS Logo in China Trademark Ruling
summary: The AWS trademark belongs to a Chinese software services company, Beijing's high court rules. Amazon . com Inc. can't use its cloud-computing business's AWS logo in China, a Beijing court ruled, the latest headache for a company that has already been hampered by Chinese regulations and rivals.

title: Alabama Receiver DeVonta Smith Wins the Heisman Trophy
summary: The Crimson Tide senior took home 447 first-place votes, beating out a trio of quarterbacks: Mac Jones of Alabama, Trevor Lawrence of Clemson and Kyle Trask of Florida. Alabama wideout DeVonta Smith was awarded the 2020 Heisman Trophy in a virtual presentation Tuesday night, becoming the first receiver since Michigan's Desmond Howard in 1991 and fourth all-time to be named college football's top athlete.

title: GOP Senators Hone State Targets in Electoral College Fight
summary: Lawmakers are set to meet in joint session Wednesday to ratify Joe Biden's presidential win. WASHINGTON-A group of Republican senators are zeroing in on three states as they hone their plans to object to the Electoral College vote count, pushed by President Trump to overturn the election of Democrat Joe Biden.

title: IBM Simplifies Structure of Sales Team
summary: Company wants to make it easier for customers to do business by reducing the number of groups it puts clients into to two from 50. International Business Machines Corp. said it is restructuring its sales organization, streamlining how it classifies customers.

title: Trump Supporters Again Protest in D.C.
summary: Demonstrators-including conspiracy theorists and extremist groups-gather in U.S. capital for third time since November vote. WASHINGTON-Some of President Trump's supporters began their planned protests Tuesday night before Congress meets Wednesday to ratify President-elect Joe Biden's Electoral College win, marking the third spate of large demonstrations in the nation's capital disputing the election results.

title: Trump Adviser Cleta Mitchell Resigns From Law Firm After Georgia Call
summary: Washington lawyer faced criticism after joining president to ask election officials to reverse Biden win. Cleta Mitchell, a Washington, D.C., lawyer who supported President Trump in making claims of election fraud on a weekend call with the Georgia secretary of state, resigned Tuesday from the partnership of a corporate law firm.

title: Grammy Awards Postponed Amid Covid-19 Concerns
summary: Ceremony, originally set to take place on Jan. 31, has been pushed back to March 14. The Grammy Awards ceremony has been postponed for two months, as concerns surge over the spread of Covid-19, according to the Recording Academy, which hosts the annual music-industry awards show.

title: NYSE Takes Heat After Flip-Flop on Chinese Companies
summary: Some investors felt whiplash from the moves; the three telecom stocks have gone on a wild ride. The New York Stock Exchange is in the hot seat after a baffling flip-flop in which it first said it would delist three Chinese companies to comply with an executive order from President Trump, only to reverse itself four days later.

title: Trump, Biden and a Media 'Secret'
summary: Recent history may explain the behavior of Republican voters.. Why do so many Donald Trump voters believe his claim that he won the fall election, despite states declaring that he didn't and numerous judges rejecting his lawsuits? Perhaps it's because some Trump conspiracy theories about the nation's political establishment turned out to be true. The Obama administration really did spy on Mr. Trump's campaign and media outlets really have been out to get him. Therefore many Trump voters resist acknowledging the duly certified victory of Joe Biden, our President-elect.

title: Trump Administration Says Russia Likely Behind SolarWinds Hack
summary: Statement from four agencies is first from administration to identify Russia as likely culprit in cyberattack. WASHINGTON-Russia is likely behind a massive, continuing hack discovered last month that has ripped through various federal government agencies and an unknown number of private organizations, the Trump administration formally said Tuesday.
